title: Is it safe to release water from Fukushima’s nuclear plant? What to know.
description: Japan’s plan to discharge treated radioactive water from the Fukushima plant faces opposition although the U.N. nuclear watchdog deems it safe.

title: In photos: The scene as deadly wildfires spread in Greece
description: Eighteen people, believed by fire officials to be migrants or refugees, were found dead in Greece’s Dadia forest after a raging wildfire swept through the northeastern Greek region.

title: Wagner mercenary group to focus on Africa, Prigozhin says in new video
description: Prigozhin, who has largely disappeared since leading a failed mutiny in June, said he was looking for new fighters to advance Russian goals in Africa.

title: Bodies of 18 possible migrants found in Greece as wildfires rage
description: Because there were no reports of missing people nearby, “the possibility that these are people who entered the country illegally is being investigated,” the Hellenic Fire Service said.

title: Why a bloc of West African countries is threatening to invade Niger
description: The recent coup in Niger is a major test of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), one of the most important organizations in Africa.

title: Children stuck in cable car 900 feet in air in Pakistan; rescue underway
description: Pakistan’s military ordered a rescue for the eight people, including six children, stuck in Battagram, in Pakistan’s Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.

title: With World Cup, Australia embraced women’s sport. Can it continue?
description: The Australian Football League has promised equal prize money for men and women, but advocates of women’s sport say there’s a still a long way to go to win parity.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky secures F-16 training on Greece trip; Americans told to leave Belarus
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky traveled to Athens to shore up relations with Greek and Balkan leaders, the European Commission president and European Council chief.

title: U.S. tells Americans to leave Belarus immediately
description: Amid a buildup of Russian troops, the U.S. Embassy warned it had “limited ability to assist” Americans in Belarus, who shouldn’t “rely on U.S. government assistance.”

title: Ukraine evacuates civilians as Russia tries to retake liberated city
description: Authorities say they can no longer guarantee the safety of those who stay in Kupyansk amid Russian shelling. Some 2,000 residents have signed releases saying they won’t hold officials responsible.

title: China’s awkward power play at the BRICS summit
description: This week’s annual summit between Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa may be another talk shop, but it brims with intrigue and interesting storylines.

title: Japan to release water from Fukushima nuclear plant from Aug. 24
description: Treated radioactive water will start being discharged into the Pacific Ocean as soon as Thursday, amid fierce opposition from neighbors and Japan’s fishing industry.

title: Former leader Thaksin back from exile as Thailand picks prime minister
description: Thaksin arrived in Bangkok on Tuesday morning, hours before the party he helped to establish, Pheu Thai, is set to form a new coalition government.
